Clinical Summary:

The patient was admitted to our hospital with a complex medical history and underwent several procedures to address their various health concerns. Upon admission, it was noted that the patient had a significant amount of cardiovascular disease, including coronary artery disease (CAD) with evidence of myocardial infarction (MI). The patient also presented with hypertension and hyperlipidemia.

The patient's renal function was compromised due to chronic kidney disease (CKD), characterized by reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR). The patient also presented with peripheral artery disease (PAD) and chronic venous insufficiency, which required wound care and management.

Furthermore, the patient had a history of anxiety disorder, evidenced by symptoms of generalized anxiety and panic attacks. The patient's mental health was closely monitored during their hospital stay.

The patient also had a history of sleep disorders, specifically insomnia and restless leg syndrome, which were managed with appropriate interventions.

Upon discharge, the patient will require close follow-up to manage their various conditions. The patient's healthcare team will monitor their cardiovascular health, renal function, and mental health closely to ensure optimal outcomes.
